page.title: 13POLITICS IN PARR.
page.content: The recent miner's strike over pit closures which ran for almost a full twelve months, affected the people of this area acutely. As a traditional mining area, the area around our school is still the home of many mining families, who suffered great financial hardship. The local Council was sensitive to this and organised several relief measures but attitudes were hardened politically when the National Union of Mineworkers failed to achieve their objective. In our own school, the effects were felt. The number of pupils claiming free school meals rose dramatically, stretching school facilities to the limit. Tensions between children of working miners and those of strikers were also evident, admittedly on a small scale but it reflected the divisions in the community over many months.
